snippet: The Steelers are forced to believe in Tebow magic after the Broncos' dramatic playoff win and the Giants used a much grittier approach to topple the Falcons.
abstract: The Steelers are forced to believe in Tebow magic after the Broncos' dramatic playoff win and the Giants used a much grittier approach to topple the Falcons.
lead_paragraph: The alert among you started getting suspicious in the waning minute of the fourth quarter, when the Steelers' inevitable march to a game-winning field goal against the Broncos stalled inexplicably. Quarterback Ben Roethlisberger, up to then engineering a spirited comeback on one leg, suddenly looked like he had forgotten everything he ever knew. Ominous, dramatic music was cued up somewhere, most likely in your head.

headline.main: Leading Off: The Price of Not Believing
